intro: Psychotria ombrophila, commonly known as the "angel's tears" or "soul of the forest," is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in the understory of dense tropical forests. Psychotria ombrophila is also notable for its role in traditional medicine and its association with the hallucinogenic properties of its related species.
